messages.title: My plan for Stoke-on-Trent Central
messages.content: People have often told me, when I am out and about, that they feel let down by their current Labour MP, who is out of touch with the people he represents. This couldn’t have been more clearly demonstrated than by his refusal to back the government’s plan to leave the European Union, even though over two-thirds of his constituents voted to leave.

keyPolicies.policyDescription:
- Investment to help redevelop derelict sites around Spode Works.
- Government investment to restore Sutherland Chambers.

- New £17.6 million investment into the Royal Stoke for new patient beds and reducing waiting times.
- £8 million fund that delivered 64 new patient beds.
20,000 new police officers are being recruited nationally, with efforts to recruit as many as possible in Stoke-on-Trent.

issues.brexitEurope: This couldn’t have been more clearly demonstrated than by his refusal to back the government’s plan to leave the European Union, even though over two-thirds of his constituents voted to leave.
issues.health: New £17.6 million investment into the Royal Stoke, providing new patient beds and reducing waiting times. This is on top of an £8 million fund that delivered 64 new patient beds.
issues.lawCrime: 20,000 new police officers are being recruited nationally, and I'm fighting for as many of them as possible to be recruited in Stoke-on-Trent.

community.content: Stoke has been successful in its bid for investment from the government’s new Heritage High Streets Fund. This £2 million investment will help redevelop derelict sites around Spode Works. This investment builds on the £900,000 given by Historic England to restore the 120-year-old Sutherland Chambers.

leaflet.personalStatement: I will work hard to deliver my plan for the people of Stoke-on-Trent Central, but I also need to hear from you.

images.caption: From Jo Gideon - Standing to be your next MP

leaflet.additionalNotes: On the reverse is a short survey, so you can give me your views on your priorities for our community. You can return your completed survey free in the envelope provided, no need for a stamp!
